title: How to Catch a Common House Lizard and Keep It As a Pet

steps.title: Get a glass aquarium and add a screen top.
steps.content: Get a glass aquarium and add a screen top. A 24 by 12 by 12 inches (61 by 30 by 30 cm) or larger tank is recommended. Make sure you seal any openings where your lizard could escape from. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use a UVB light or a heating pad set on low to warm your pet’s new home to the appropriate temperatures.
steps.content: Use a UVB light or a heating pad set on low to warm your pet’s new home to the appropriate temperatures. Lizards are cold-blooded creatures that rely on outside warmth to function. The tank should be a minimum of 80 °F (27 °C) at one end with a basking area with a temperature of about 95 °F (35 °C). [4] X Research source Do not use heated rocks because they can cause your lizard to overheat.

steps.title: Choose a flooring that is easy to clean.
steps.content: Choose a flooring that is easy to clean. Paper towels and newspapers are inexpensive options that work well for smaller and medium-sized lizards and are easy to change. If you want to breed your lizard, add about half-inch soil mixed with sand. Maintain proper temperature. You should also know what sex is your gecko (male or female).

steps.title: Create visual barriers with vining plants, smaller branches, pieces of bark or hide boxes.
steps.content: Create visual barriers with vining plants, smaller branches, pieces of bark or hide boxes. Your lizard likes to defend itself by hiding. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Locate an area near your home where you see lizards regularly.
steps.content: Locate an area near your home where you see lizards regularly. Lizards like warmth and sunlight, so look for sunny outdoor spots.

steps.title: Capture a lizard by either setting a trap or using a lizard fishing pole.
steps.content: Capture a lizard by either setting a trap or using a lizard fishing pole. Setting a trap: Find an odorless box, cover it with plastic wrap and cut a slit. Place the box in a location where you have seen lizards and add live insect bait. Check the trap two or three times a day. It may take several days to catch the lizard, so make sure replace the bait as necessary. Using a lizard fishing pole: Source a stick that is at least 3 feet (0.91 m) and a long piece of dental floss. Tie the dental floss to one end of the stick. Make a slip knot out of the other end with a loop large enough to fit around a lizard’s neck. Approach the lizard of your choice slowly and gently fit the loop around its neck. The best time to catch lizards is early in the day because they have not had a chance to warm up and will move more slowly.

steps.title: Identify your new lizard using a resource such as Animal World.
steps.content: Identify your new lizard using a resource such as Animal World. Geckos, anoles, and skinks are common types of lizards that can make good pets.

steps.title: Handle your new pet carefully.
steps.content: Handle your new pet carefully. Lizards, like any other animal, can feel pain. Some signs that your lizard is feeling uncomfortable include biting, thrashing around, clawing, and scrambling. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Scoop up your lizard in your hand and hold its head delicately between your thumb and forefinger.
steps.content: Scoop up your lizard in your hand and hold its head delicately between your thumb and forefinger. Alternatively, clasp it in your hand while grasping one of its front legs between your thumb and forefinger. With this method, your lizard is likely to struggle and may bite you. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Place one hand gently over the back of your lizard.
steps.content: Place one hand gently over the back of your lizard. Use your other hand to grasp your lizard around its sides with just enough pressure to hold it still.

steps.title: Make sure to support the lizard’s body weight and length and allow them to become comfortable.
steps.content: Make sure to support the lizard’s body weight and length and allow them to become comfortable. Be calm and make smooth motions. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Provide water for your lizard daily.
steps.content: Provide water for your lizard daily. Depending on the type of lizard, a shallow container of water, a bubbler bowl (for lizards who do not drink still water), or misting the walls of the cage daily will work (for arboreal and desert lizards) as water sources. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase insects such as live crickets or super mealworms and wax mealworms larvae from the pet store to feed your lizard 5 to 7 times a week.
steps.content: Purchase insects such as live crickets or super mealworms and wax mealworms larvae from the pet store to feed your lizard 5 to 7 times a week. Make sure to buy insects of the appropriate size for your lizard. [10] X Research source Start with 6 insects to see how many your pet will eat. "Leftover" food can be dangerous to your lizard while it is asleep, so it is important to not put too many insects into the tank.

steps.title: Clean the tank whenever it smells musty or you see animal waste.
steps.content: Clean the tank whenever it smells musty or you see animal waste. Remove the flooring. If it is paper, discard the original and replace with new paper towels or newspaper. If it is gravel or carpet, wash the existing flooring and set back into the cage. Mist the cage with cleaner. A good cleaner is a mixture that is one part alcohol and two parts water with a drop or two of dishwashing liquid. Wipe the cage dry. [11] X Research source
